job_tasks.phrase: deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core activities of data processing, validation, and loading, which are fundamental to data engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
job_tasks.justification: ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) solutions and calculation engines are key components of data engineering pipelines.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
job_tasks.justification: Implementing architectural changes to deliver data involves software development principles for integration and data flow.

job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the responsibility for the entire software lifecycle, a core aspect of software development.

job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
job_tasks.justification: Focus on creating trustworthy software and applying security standards is a key part of secure software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
job_tasks.justification: Building deployment pipelines for CI/CD is a direct description of MLOps practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
job_tasks.justification: Automating tests within the development lifecycle is a core practice in MLOps/DevOps.

job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
job_tasks.justification: Implementing observability and monitoring for product performance is a key MLOps responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: Improvement of the service stability and continuity.
job_tasks.justification: Improving stability and continuity relates to the robustness and reliability of developed software systems.

job_tasks.phrase: Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
job_tasks.justification: These are all advanced MLOps/DevOps practices related to infrastructure and deployment automation.

job_tasks.phrase: strengthen us in Credit Risk. We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program.
job_tasks.justification: This indicates a need to understand the credit risk domain and contribute to its architectural evolution.

job_tasks.phrase: Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING.
job_tasks.justification: This demonstrates an understanding of the business context and the ultimate goal of delivering value to the organization.

soft_skills.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing
We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.

classification.rationale: While there are mentions of data processing and software development, the core focus is on traditional software engineering and MLOps practices within a credit risk domain. There is no explicit mention or strong implication of Generative AI models, LLMs, or related specialized tasks, which are central to the GenAI Engineer profile.
